definition: to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed

sentences.english: How Do You Report Suspected Tax Fraud Activity?
sentences.chinese: 如何举报可疑的税物造假行为？

sentences.english: The Anti-monopoly Authority shall maintain the confidentiality of the person making such report.
sentences.chinese: 反垄断执法机构应当为举报人保密。

sentences.english: Of them, 735 complaints involved building management.
sentences.chinese: 其中，有关楼宇管理的贪污举报735宗。

sentences.english: Ask your users to report trolls and call them out for polluting the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 要求你的用户举报攻讦者，称他们妨碍了对话。

sentences.english: Open the message, Douqing Fu found that this is a public report.
sentences.chinese: 打开短消息，窦庆福发现这是一条市民举报。

sentences.english: The authorities have even encouraged citizens to rat on violators through a new telephone hotline.
sentences.chinese: 政府甚至鼓励市民通过热线电话举报违反禁烟令的人。

sentences.english: If the informant offers the tipoff in his (its) real name, he (it) shall be given a reply about the handling result and other information.
sentences.chinese: 对实名举报的，应当将处理结果等情况予以回复。

sentences.english: It announced an email address for users to send reports of possible falsehoods.
sentences.chinese: 新浪还专设了举报邮箱，供用户举报疑似虚假消息。

sentences.english: It announced an email address for users to send reports of possible falsehoods.
sentences.chinese: 新浪还专设了举报邮箱，供用户举报疑似虚假消息。

sentences.english: School vacation gives a student remedial teaching , where should report an offence to?
sentences.chinese: 学校假期给学生补课，该向哪里举报？

sentences.english: Meanwhile, police also hope that the masses in reporting and to provide clues.
sentences.chinese: 同时，警方也希望广大群众积极举报并提供线索。

sentences.english: Once the manager to the head office to report the mu-lan jiang favouritism, resulting in tian mi violations.
sentences.chinese: 曾经理向总部举报了江木兰徇私，导致田咪违规。

sentences.english: About Free Moible Phone Number to Call The Police.
sentences.chinese: 晕了，是关于免费举报电话的。

sentences.english: The organ that accepts a tip-off shall keep confidential the tip-off maker as well as the tipped-off contents.
sentences.chinese: 接受举报的机关应当对举报人和举报内容保密。

sentences.english: The organ that accepts a tip-off shall keep confidential the tip-off maker as well as the tipped-off contents.
sentences.chinese: 接受举报的机关应当对举报人和举报内容保密。

sentences.english: The organ that accepts a tip-off shall keep confidential the tip-off maker as well as the tipped-off contents.
sentences.chinese: 接受举报的机关应当对举报人和举报内容保密。

definition: to report (an offense to the authorities)/to inform against sb
complaint/to complain/to register a complaint (esp. as a customer)
to expose/to bring to light/to disclose/revelation
to file a complaint/to appeal (to an authority, a higher court of justice etc)/complaint/appeal
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
to report a case to the authorities
to register (to an official organism)/to file a case (for investigation)
